useCase.name: Opening TaRGeT
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT should behave when it is started up.

flow.description: Start up the TaRGeT.

step.action: Start the TaRGeT.
step.condition: The .NET and Java runtime environment are installed in the machine (see requirements for further information about Java and .NET versions) [ER_TARGET_0015, ER_TARGET_0020, ER_TARGET_0025]
step.response: A splash screen is displayed. Verify the requirements document to check the splash screen. [FR_TARGET_0220]

flow.description: The .NET runtime environment is not installed in the machine.

step.action: Try to start the TaRGeT.
step.condition: Java runtime environment is installed in the machine. The .NET runtime environment is not installed in the machine (see requirements for further information about Java and .NET versions). [ER_TARGET_0020, ER_TARGET_0025]
step.response: A message is displayed informing that an error has occurred and asking the user to see the log file. [FR_TARGET_0230]

flow.description: The Java runtime environment is not installed in the machine.

step.action: Try to start the TaRGeT.
step.condition: The Java runtime environment is not installed in the machine (see requirements for further information about Java version). [ER_TARGET_0020]
step.response: A message is displayed informing that no JRE is installed. The TaRGeT is not started up. [FR_TARGET_0230]

useCase.name: Creating a Project from Blank Work Area
useCase.description: This use case describes the creation of a TaRGeT project when no project is opened.

flow.description: Create a new project when no project is opened.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up. No project is opened.
step.response: The “New Project” option is enabled in the drop down menu. The Close Project option is disabled.

flow.description: Type a valid project name.
Cancel the project creation.
Browse the destination folder.
Type an invalid project name.
No project name is typed.
Project directory already exists.
to create the project and delete all folder contents.

useCase.name: Creating a Project from an Already Opened Project
useCase.description: This use case describes the creation of a TaRGeT project when a project is opened.

flow.description: Create a new project when a project is opened.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up. A project is already opened.
step.response: The “New Project” option is enabled in the drop down menu.

flow.description: Click on “No” button.

useCase.name: Closing a Project
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT behaves while closing a project.

flow.description: Close a project.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is started up and a project is already opened.
step.response: The “Close Project” option is enabled.

flow.description: Cancel the project closing.

useCase.name: Opening an Existing Project from Blank Work Area
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT behaves while an existing project is opened by the user. This use case describes the project opening when no project is opened.

flow.description: Open an existing project from an empty work area.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is already started up. No project is opened.
step.response: The “Open Project” option is enabled.

flow.description: Cancel the project opening.

useCase.name: Opening an Existing Project from an Already Opened Project
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT behaves while an existing project is opened by the user. It describes the project opening when a project is already opened.

flow.description: Open an existing project from an already opened project.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is already started up. A project is already opened.
step.response: The “Open Project” option is enabled.

flow.description: Cancel the project opening.

useCase.name: Importing Valid Use Case Documents
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when valid use case documents are imported to a project.

flow.description: Import a use case document.

step.action: Go to “Artifacts” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is started up. A project is already opened.
step.response: The “Import Use Case Documents” option is enabled.

flow.description: Import another document.
Cancel the importing.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document Containing Interruptions
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document that contains an interruption specification is imported to a project.

flow.description: Imported Use Case Document contains one or more interruption specifications.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a use case document that contains at least one interruption.
step.condition: There is no imported document.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

flow.description: Import another document that contains interruptions.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Duplicated Feature ID
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document with duplicated feature ID is imported to a project.

flow.description: Imported Use Case Document has duplicated feature ID.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a use case document with duplicated feature ID. This means that the document contains at least two features with the same ID. The document does not contain any interruption.
step.condition: There is no imported document.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Duplicated Interruption ID
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document with duplicated interruption ID is imported to a project.

flow.description: Imported Use Case Document has duplicated interruption ID.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a use case document with duplicated interruption ID. This means that the document contains at least two interruptions with the same ID.
step.condition: There is no imported document.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

flow.description: Imported Use Case Document has duplicated interruption ID with another one already imported.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a use case document with an interruption whose ID is the same of an already imported interruption.
step.condition: There is an imported document with at least one interruption.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Duplicated Use Case ID
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document with duplicated use case ID is imported to a project.

flow.description: Imported Use Case Document has duplicated use case ID.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a use case document with duplicated use case ID. This means that the document contains a feature that has at least two use cases with the same ID. The document does not contain any interruption.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Invalid Structure
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document with invalid structure is imported to a project.

flow.description: Imported Use Case Document has an invalid structure.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a use case document with invalid structure.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

flow.description: Import another document.
Cancel the importing.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document with an Empty Mandatory Field
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document with an empty mandatory is imported to a project.

flow.description: Selected use case document has an empty mandatory field.

step.action: Select “Browser” button and browse a use case document with an empty mandatory field. The document does not contain any interruption.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Invalid Step ID References
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document with invalid id references is imported to a project.

flow.description: The selected use case document contains invalid id references.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a use case document with invalid ID references. The document does not contain any interruption.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

flow.description: Import another valid document.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Invalid Step ID References in Interruptions
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document with invalid id references is imported to a project.

flow.description: The selected use case document contains invalid id references in an interruption.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a use case document with invalid ID references in an interruption.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Duplicated Step IDs
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document with duplicated step IDs is imported to a project.

flow.description: The selected use case document contains duplicated ids.

step.action: Select “Browser” button and browse a use case document with duplicated step ids. The document contains at least two steps in a use case with the same ID. The document does not contain any interruption.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Duplicated Step IDs in Interruptions
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document with duplicated step IDs in interruptions is imported to a project.

flow.description: The selected use case document contains duplicated ids in an interruption.

step.action: Select “Browser” button and browse a use case document with duplicated step ids in an interruption. The document contains at least two steps in an interruption with the same ID.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document with a Feature Already Imported.
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT shall behave when a use case document is imported to a project and another use case document is already imported and the documents have at least one feature with same name and ID.

flow.description: Import a use case document when another use case document is already imported. The use case documents have at least one common feature with same ID and name.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a valid use case document. The document and the already imported document have at least one common feature with same ID and name and the use cases IDs are different. Both documents do not contain any interruption.
step.condition: There is at least one valid document imported in the project. The document does not contain any interruption.
step.response: The “Import Documents” window is displayed. The “Finish” button is enabled.

flow.description: Import a use case document when another use case document is already imported. The use case documents have at least one common feature with same ID and different names.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a valid use case document. The document and the already imported document have at least one common feature with same ID but different names and the use cases IDs are different.
step.condition: There is at least one valid document imported in the project.
step.response: The “Import Documents” window is displayed. The “Finish” button is enabled.

flow.description: Import a document that contains a feature with same ID of another feature that belongs to a previously imported document.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a valid use case document. The document and the already imported document have at least one common feature with same ID. The features have at least one use case with same ID. [FR_TARGET_0125]
step.condition: There is at least one valid imported document.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list.

useCase.name: Viewing Use Case Documents with Microsoft Word
useCase.description: This use case describes how use case documents can be viewed in TaRGeT with the Microsoft Word.

flow.description: Double-click on the document.

step.action: Double-click on a use case document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported document.
step.response: The Microsoft Word is invoked and the document is opened. [FR_TARGET_0005]

useCase.name: Viewing Valid Use Case in HTML Format
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT use cases can be viewed in HTML format.

flow.description: View valid use case documents in HTML format in the main panel, by double-clicking the use case.

step.action: Double-click on a use case in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported valid use case document.
step.response: The selected Use Case is displayed in HTML format in the main panel. [FR_TARGET_0130]

flow.description: View use case documents in HTML format in the main panel, by right-clicking the use case.

step.action: Right-click on a use case in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported valid use case document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with two options.

flow.description: View use case documents in HTML format in the default browser, by right-clicking the use case.

useCase.name: Viewing Invalid Use Case in HTML Format
useCase.description: This use case describes how the TaRGeT use cases can be viewed in HTML format when they have some error.

flow.description: View use case documents with duplicated step ID in HTML format in the main panel, by double-clicking the use case.

step.action: Double-click on a use case with duplicated step ID in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported use case with duplicated step ID.
step.response: The selected Use Case is displayed in HTML format in the main panel. The duplicated steps IDs are highlighted. [FR_TARGET_0130]

flow.description: View use case documents with invalid step ID reference in HTML format in the main panel, by right-clicking the use case.

step.action: Right-click on a use case with invalid step ID reference in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported use case with invalid step ID reference.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with two options.

flow.description: View use case documents with empty mandatory fields in HTML format in the default browser, by right-clicking the use case.

useCase.name: Viewing Valid Interruption in HTML Format
useCase.description: This use case describes how the interruptions can be viewed in HTML format.

flow.description: View valid interruptions in HTML format in the main panel, by double-clicking the use case.

step.action: Double-click on an interruption in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported valid use case document that contains interruptions.
step.response: The selected interruption is displayed in HTML format in the main panel. [FR_TARGET_0131]

flow.description: View interruptions in HTML format in the main panel, by right-clicking the use case.

step.action: Right-click on an interruption in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported valid use case document that contains interruptions.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with two options.

flow.description: View interruptions in HTML format in the default browser, by right-clicking the use case.

useCase.name: Viewing a Generated Test Suite with Microsoft Excel
useCase.description: This use case describes how the generated test suite documents can be viewed in TaRGeT with the Microsoft Excel.

flow.description: Double-click on the document.

step.action: Double-click on a test suite document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one already generated test suite.
step.response: The Microsoft Excel is invoked and the document is opened. [FR_TARGET_0005]

useCase.name: Renaming a Document
useCase.description: This use case describes how test suite and use case documents are renamed in TaRGeT.

flow.description: Rename a test suite document.

step.action: Right-click on a generated test suite document in the “Artifacts” view. [FR_TARGET_0001]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one already generated test suite.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Rename a use case document.

step.action: Right-click on a use case document in the “Artifacts” view. [FR_TARGET_0001]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported use case document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Select to rename more than one document.

step.action: In the “Artifacts” view, Select more than one document and right-click on the selection. [FR_TARGET_0001]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two documents (test suite or use case documents).
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. The “Rename” option is disabled.

flow.description: Type an invalid document name.
Type a document name that is being used by another document.

step.action: Right-click on a use case document in the “Artifacts” view. [FR_TARGET_0001]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two test suites or two use case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. The “Rename” option is enabled.

flow.description: Type an empty name.

useCase.name: Deleting a Document
useCase.description: This use case describes how test suite and use case documents are deleted in TaRGeT.

flow.description: Delete a test suite document.

step.action: Right-click on a generated test suite document in the “Artifacts” view. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one already generated test suite.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Delete a use case document that is not referred by another document.

step.action: Right-click on a use case document in the “Artifacts” view. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported use case document. The imported documents do not refer to a use case of another imported document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Delete a use case document that is referred by another document.

step.action: Right-click on a use case document in the “Artifacts” view. The selected document is referred by a use case of another imported document. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two imported use case documents. A use case is referred by another use case from a different document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Delete more than one generated test suite.

step.action: In the “Artifacts” view, Select more than one test suite document and right-click on the selection. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two generated test suites.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Delete one test suite and one use case document that is being referenced.

step.action: In the “Artifacts” view, Select one test suite document and a use case document, and right-click on the selection. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two imported use case document and at least one generated test suite. The imported use case document is referenced by another imported document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Delete two use case documents. One document refers to the other.

step.action: In the “Artifacts” view, Select one test suite two use case documents, and right-click on the selection. One of the selected documents refers to the other. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has two imported use case document. One imported use case document is referenced by the other.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Cancel the document deletion.

useCase.name: Updating the Use Case Documents outside the TaRGeT UI
useCase.description: This use case describes how use case documents are updated outside TarGeT UI.

flow.description: Fix a use case document with duplicated step ID outside TaRGeT UI.

step.action: Open an already imported use case document with the Microsoft Word (outside the TaRGeT). The document has a duplicated step ID.
step.condition: TaRGeT is started up and a project is opened. There is at least one imported use case document with duplicated step ID in the project.
step.response: The document is opened in the default viewer outside the TaRGeT.

useCase.name: Rejecting a Damaged Use Case Documents
useCase.description: This use case describes how use case documents are rejected after their structure is damaged.

flow.description: Damage an imported use case document.

step.action: Double-click on a use case document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. There is one imported and valid use case document.
step.response: The Microsoft Word is invoked and the document is opened. [FR_TARGET_0005]

useCase.name: Rejecting a Use Case Document With Duplicated Feature ID
useCase.description: This use case describes how use case documents are rejected after assigning to a feature an ID that is being used by a feature of another document.

flow.description: Assign to a feature an ID that is being used by a feature of another document.

step.action: Double-click on a use case document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. There is two imported and valid use case document.
step.response: The Microsoft Word is invoked and the document is opened. [FR_TARGET_0005]

useCase.name: Rejecting a Use Case Document With Duplicated Use Case ID
useCase.description: This use case describes how use case documents are rejected after assigning to a use case an ID that is being used by another use case of the same feature.

flow.description: Assign to a feature an ID that is being used by a feature of another document.

step.action: Double-click on a use case document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. There is one imported and valid use case document. The document has at least one feature with more than one use case.
step.response: The Microsoft Word is invoked and the document is opened. [FR_TARGET_0005]

useCase.name: Searching for Use Cases
useCase.description: This use case describes how to search for use cases within TaRGeT.

flow.description: Perform a search when some valid use case documents are already imported.

step.action: Choose “Tools” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is started up. A project is already opened. There is at least one document imported. No error is listed in the “Error” list.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. “Search” option is available.

flow.description: Cancel the search.
Perform a search using the specific field “Use Case Identifier”.
Perform a search using the specific field “From Step”.

useCase.name: Viewing Search Results
useCase.description: This use case describes how the search result can be viewed within TaRGeT.

flow.description: View found use case documents in HTML format by double-clicking the use case.

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites
useCase.description: This use case describes how the test suites are generated within TaRGeT.

flow.description: Generate test cases by requirements.

step.action: Choose “Tools” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up. A project is opened and some use cases are already imported. No error is listed in the “Error” list.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. “Test Generation” option is available.

flow.description: Try to generate tests with errors in the project.

step.action: Choose “Tools” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up. A project is opened and some use case documentation is already imported. There is at least one error is listed in the “Error” list.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. “Test Generation” option is available.

flow.description: Cancel the generation.
All requirements are selected.
Generate all test cases.

step.action: Choose "Tools" option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up. A project is opened and some use cases are already imported. No error is listed in the "Error" list.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. "Test Generation" option is available.

flow.description: There is no reference to any requirement in the imported use cases.

step.action: Choose “Test Generation” option in the drop down menu.
step.condition: No requirement is referenced in the imported use cases.
step.response: The Test Generation window is displayed. The “Requirements List” is disabled. The “Select All” and “Deselect All” buttons are disabled.

flow.description: Deselect All” button is clicked.

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites with Test Purposes
useCase.description: This use case describes how the test suites are generated using test purposes within TaRGeT.

flow.description: Generate test cases using one test purpose composed of one step.

step.action: Select some requirements. [FR_TARGET_0145]
step.condition: The imported use cases have more than one step which refers to distinct requirements.
step.response: Some requirements are selected.

flow.description: Generate test cases using two test purposes.
Clear the current test purpose field.
Remove a test purpose from the created test purposes list.

step.action: Select a test purpose on “Created Test purposes” list.
step.condition: There is at least one test purpose on the “Created Test purposes” list.
step.response: The test purpose is highlighted.

flow.description: Remove all test purposes from the created test purposes list.

step.action: Click on “Clear All” button on “Created Test Purposes” area.
step.condition: There is more than one test purpose on “Test purposes” list.
step.response: The “Created Test Purposes” list is empty.

flow.description: Path coverage percentage is 50%.

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites by Use Cases
useCase.description: This use case describes how the test suites are generated in order to cover some selected use cases.

flow.description: Generate test cases by use cases.
Remove selected use cases.

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites With Interruptions
useCase.description: This use case describes how the test suites are generated from use cases that are embedded by interruptions.

flow.description: Generate test cases with interruptions.
Link again an interruption to a step.
Remove link between an interruption to a step.
Remove all interruption - step links.

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites Changing Test Case Field Parameters
useCase.description: This use case describes how the user can parameterize the test case fields.

flow.description: Changing “Objective prefix” parameter.

step.action: Open the properties file, change the “tcg.objective_prefix” parameter, and save the properties file.
step.condition: TaRGeT application is closed.
step.response: The properties file is changed. [FR_TARGET_0175]

step.action: Run TaRGeT application, and open a project that contains valid imported documents.
step.condition: There is an already created project with at least one imported use case.
step.response: The TaRGeT is started up, and the project is opened.

flow.description: Changing “Empty Field” parameter.

step.action: Open the properties file, change the “tcg.empty_field” parameter, and save the properties file.
step.condition: TaRGeT application is closed.
step.response: The properties file is changed. [FR_TARGET_0175]

step.action: Run TaRGeT application, and open a project that contains valid imported documents.
step.condition: There is an already created project with at least one imported use case.
step.response: The TaRGeT is started up, and the project is opened.

flow.description: Changing “Test Case Id” parameter to a fixed value.

step.action: Open the properties file, change the “tcg.tescase_id” parameter to a fixed value, and save the properties file.
step.condition: TaRGeT application is closed.
step.response: The properties file is changed. [FR_TARGET_0175]

step.action: Run TaRGeT application, and open a project that contains valid imported documents.
step.condition: There is an already created project with at least one imported use case.
step.response: The TaRGeT is started up, and the project is opened.

flow.description: Changing “Test Case Id” parameter to a value that changes accordingly to its id.

step.action: Open ...
step.condition: TaRGeT application is closed.
step.response: The properties file is changed. [FR_TARGET_0175]

step.action: Run TaRGeT application, and open a project that contains valid imported documents.
step.condition: There is an already created project with at least one imported use case.
step.response: The TaRGeT is started up, and the project is opened.

flow.description: Changing “Test Case Id” parameter to a value that contains an incremental id and the feature id.

step.action: Open the properties file, change the Save the properties file.
step.condition: TaRGeT application is closed.
step.response: The properties file is changed. [FR_TARGET_0175]

step.action: Run TaRGeT application, and open a project that contains valid imported documents.
step.condition: There is an already created project with at least one imported use case.
step.response: The TaRGeT is started up, and the project is opened.

useCase.name: Viewing the About Window
useCase.description: This use case describes how the about window is displayed.

flow.description: Access the about window.

step.action: Choose “Help” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

useCase.name: Viewing the Help Window
useCase.description: This use case describes how the about window is displayed.

flow.description: Access the help window.

step.action: Choose “Help” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.
